lines.text: But how extraordinary... some people make this passage year after year without seeing even enough ice to put in a cocktail. And here are we, meeting a real 'berg the very first time
[chuckles]
. Aren't we lucky!
Thanks. Leave me here. I'm only in the way on deck. At least 150 people so far have fallen over my chair. Fifteen of them have cursed me. Besides, the whole thing's too damned silly.
Then you do not believe it to be really serious, sir?
No, of course not. This ship is no more likely to sink than St Paul's Cathedral. Although they're always mucking about with that.
I'm not going to give way to panic as long as the ship's perfectly safe.
I'm not going to move for anyone.
You do what your father tells you, child.

[scornfully]
father, huh!

[scornfully]
Your father...
Betty, you little fool. He's trying to save your life.
Save my life?
What do you mean?
The ship that you thought so safe will sink in about two hours.
Mr Rool!
Good god!
Mother!
And the measure of your father's love is... that he hasn't told you.
Daddy! Daddy!
It's not true. Freddie, it can't be true.
I'm afraid it is, Clara.
But you must come too. You must come.
I can't, my dear. I would if I could.
All the women who would go have gone, Sir. The boats have cleared the ship.
Men you have done your full duty. You can do no more. Now, it is every man for himself.
Lanchester, you are no longer under my orders. But...
I'm still under your orders, Sir.
See?
[points to a child alone on the flooded deck]
. Do you think you could make the last boat? Then the child would be saved... even if there wasn't room for you.
I understand, Sir.
Goodbye, Lanchester. Good luck.
Hello, Tate-Hughes. Seen your women off?
No. I haven't. Neither wife nor daughter will go. The wife won't leave her luggage or the dresses she bought in Paris. Betty's merely rude.
Better make 'em go.
I can't. They won't listen to me. They're huffy about something.
Mrs Lilly, hmmm?
Something like that.
Anyhow, if you still love your wife and daughter, you'd better get them to the boats without delay.
Why? The ship's quite safe, isn't it?
Oh, yes... for a couple of hours.
Come along, Monica, darling. There's nothing to worry about. The ship's perfectly safe.
I know there's something wrong. They're calling for help. That's what they're doing. They're not sending me away on a boat and keeping you back are they? Are they?
No, of course not, darling.
Lawrie, this isn't the end - not so soon, is it?
[sobs]
Oh, my darling
[they clasp each other]
. The ship isn't sinking, is it?
Of course not. Don't be a silly.
